titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 95: Copies of documents pertaining to the Ospedale della Misericordia in Lucca

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 95: Copies of documents pertaining to the Ospedale della Misericordia in Lucca are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Incipit of first document: (f. 2r) Copia. Frater Guilelmus Dei et apostolice sedis gratia episcopus Lucanus dilectis nobis in Christo filiis confratribus societatis ditte de Cruce in ecclesia et loco hospitalis misericordie de Luca positus intra portam Sancti Donati ...
On the last few folios, particularly f. 47, much of the text is either missing or difficult to make out due to the deterioration of the paper.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: 15th-century copies of documents dated 1336-1489 pertaining to the founding by brothers Matteo, Nicola, and Piero Busdraghi of the Ospedale della Misericordia, of the Confraternita della Santa Croce, attached to the church of San Nicola in Lucca, to serve the poor and sick, and the subsequent history of the Ospedale.

msItem.title: Copies of documents pertaining to the Ospedale della Misericordia in Lucca

supportDesc.extent: 47 leaves : 315 x 220 (235 x 160) mm. bound to 318 x 229 mm

collation.p: Paper, 47; 1⁴⁴ 2²(+1); [1], 2-47; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in an italic script by a single hand.

binding.p: Thick, white rag boards with sewing visible at spine. Edges reddened from acid in boards.

origin.p: Written in Lucca, Italy, after 1489 (formerly last date in manuscript now lost to damage, f. 47; extant last date is 1485, f. 40r).
